intro: Hubertia heimii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of Africa. It features fleshy, ribbed stems and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. It blooms during the rainy season, typically in summer, adding vibrant color to its surroundings. Hubertia heimii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
